title: D-Day Normandy Landings
summary: On June 6, 1944 — D-Day — Allied forces launched the largest seaborne invasion in history on the beaches of Normandy, France. Over 156,000 American, British, and Canadian troops stormed five beaches under heavy German fire. The operation, codenamed Operation Overlord, opened a crucial Western Front against Nazi Germany and is widely regarded as the turning point that led to the liberation of Western Europe.
